Author: Mahendar Singh Jakhar
Quotes: “Never give-up on yourself when you have a bad day, and somebody will not give up on you.”

Author: Shunya
Quotes: “To find what you're looking for in a cluttered room, you may have to organize the whole room. You may have to give time to the things that you're not looking for. No effort goes waste. Everything is connected.”

Author: Gino DiCaprio,
Quotes: “The Universe knows everything about you, and will bring to you, either what matches you, or even better than what you may expect. You cannot just dream yourself to what you want; you have to work on it, for the Universe puts the possibilities in front of you, while it is your job to notice it and do something about it.”

Author: Gino DiCaprio,
Quotes: “You become what your thoughts envision. Therefore, you create what your life will be. You are each, your own Creator, and no one can create for you what you want or do not want. That is unless you give up your power to them. Do you comprehend this?

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “Search deeply within your soul, you will find the strength to overcome any situation.”

Author: shruthi laya
Quotes: “I don't have wishes, I make plans”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “Why seek help, where there is no help?”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “Moral wisdom delivers a man from wrongdoing.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “People must purpose to pray.”

Author: Jazalyn,
Quotes: “I never knew how to have

Author: Jazalyn,
Quotes: “Life is love;

Author: Jazalyn,
Quotes: “In those early days

Author: Jazalyn,
Quotes: “I know there’s a reality

Author: Jazalyn,
Quotes: “In an Earth of war

Author: Constance Friday
Quotes: “The things you allow to control your mind will also control your perception of reality”

Author: Joseph Perry Grassi,
Quotes: “Work harder; not smarter.”

Author: Joseph Perry Grassi,
Quotes: “Rank comes with responsibility whether you’re ready or not”

Author: Alyaa Sadek,
Quotes: “You are part of the universe after all – at times, you are in control; other times, you are bound to let go and flow by witnessing the magic of this world, that’s part of being alive.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “When a man sets his heart to a fulfil his mission with all his might, invisible forces comes to his aid.”

Author: Ozan Kulcu,
Quotes: “Growth is nothing more than transforming your imperfections into strengths.”

Author: Ozan Kulcu,
Quotes: “Uniqueness is an attribute of people who choose to live life on their own terms.”

Author: Kiara Shankar,
Quotes: “Be yourself and embrace the moment, even if others rejected you." - Avocado the Turtle”

Author: Aarti Raheja,
Quotes: “A life of surrender, giving up control, was the simplest solution to living a peaceful life.”

Author: Alyaa Sadek,
Quotes: “There is hardly any element that contains the same vigor as our emotions do. Embark on a journey of spirituality and self-growth by embracing your emotions.”

Author: Zeeshan Ali
Quotes: “If you want to learn something, then make mistakes or ask someone. I think both are the best ways to learn.”

Author: Brajesh Kumar Singh
Quotes: “Positive attitude towards your goal can lead you to success.”

Author: Ozan Kulcu,
Quotes: “Everyone has a side you do not know, just like even you have a side that you do not know yet.”

Author: Ozan Kulcu,
Quotes: “Make peace your standard emotion. Make it the home of your mind. Live in peace.”

Author: Zeeshan Ali
Quotes: “For a successful life, you should have to learn from your past. Think the mistakes you've made in the past, but learn from that instead of regret.”

Author: Ozan Kulcu,
Quotes: “You have limited amount of moments in which you are alive.”

Author: Ozan Kulcu,
Quotes: “Sadness is a healing emotion. It is a drug. It puts us in a calmer state. If we embrace sadness properly, we will be in a cosy state rather than in pain.”

Author: Ozan Kulcu,
Quotes: “Joy is a good state to be in. But it is not a life target to be joyful. It is not an aim. It does not exist in the end.It exists now.”

Author: Ozan Kulcu,
Quotes: “Let the past be your wisdom. Let the future be your intention. Let the present be your life.”

Author: Ozan Kulcu,
Quotes: “Confidence receives attention. It invites attention. Because confidence is when a person is not afraid of attention but rather welcomes it with open arms.”

Author: Ozan Kulcu,
Quotes: “When we feel anger and we use it well, that gives us huge dignity. When we feel fear and we use it well, it saves our lives. When we feel shame and we use it well, it gives us humility.”

Author: Ozan Kulcu,
Quotes: “When your time comes to leave this life, make sure not to regret the things you have not done.”

Author: Ozan Kulcu,
Quotes: “We transform instantly as soon as the purpose speaks louder than the ego.”

Author: Ozan Kulcu,
Quotes: “You are a part of a universal balance. Everything that is out of your control happens in a way that you will become an important part of this balance.”

Author: Aarti Raheja,
Quotes: “What does it take to love? I pondered.

Author: Nikhil  Sharda
Quotes: “We always fail when we try,

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “The creator provides food for all his creation.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “Praise is a perpetual prosperity.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “If we humble ourselves, God will lift us high.”

Author: Matt Haig,
Quotes: “There is no rejection, there is only redirection. You can have everything and feel nothing.”

Author: Samuel Clément
Quotes: “The fact that life throws anything at you is a great way to knowing you can become anything.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Even if a sandalwood is cut, it does not forsake its fragrance; even if an elephant grows old, it does not forsake its sportiveness; even if a sugarcane is squeezed in a mill, it does not forsake its sweetness; likewise, even if reduced to abject poverty, a man of noble lineage does not forsake his noble qualities.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Who after receiving wealth is not proud? Which licentious person’s calamities have ended? Whose heart women have not shattered on this earth? Who is always loved by the king? Who has not suffered the ravages of time? Which beggar has attained glory? Who has skilfully walked the worldly path after falling in the evil of evil persons?”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “In a man of discrimination, merits acquire the desired recognition; in gold when a gem is set, it sparkles most appropriately.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “In wealth, in living life, in women, and in eating, all beings have remained unsatisfied; so have they gone and so will they go.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “By offering loving sentences, all beings are satisfied; thus, such sentences only should be spoken; in speech why should one be miserly?”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “The worldly poisonous tree has only two nectar-like fruits; well-spoken words and the delicious company of cultured people.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “The person whose knowledge is confined to books, and whose wealth is in the control of others; in times of need finds his knowledge as no knowledge and his wealth as no wealth.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Which vice can be worse than greed? What can be more sinful than slander? For a truthful person, wherein is the need for austerity? For a person with a pure heart, wherein is the need for a pilgrimage? For a person who gives and gets respect from others, wherein is the need for acquiring other virtue? For a man decorated with fame, of what value is other ornamentation? For a man having true knowledge, wherein is the need for wealth? For a man dishonoured, what could be worse in death?”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “When a man is devoid of strength, he becomes an ascetic; when a man is without wealth, he behaves like a celibate; when a man is sick, he becomes a devotee of god; and when a woman grows old, she becomes faithful to her husband.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “The snake has poison in its fang, the fly on its head, the scorpion in its tail, but an evil person is poisonous in all parts.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “In whose heart the desire to benefit others is always active; his troubles are destroyed and he receives wealth at each step.”

Author: Rajen Jani
Quotes: “If the beloved is there, if wealth is present, if the son is filled with good qualities, and if a grandson is born, then what does heaven, the city of gods, have more than this?”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Food, sleep, fear, and sexual intercourse, is common in man and animals; knowledge is the extra that makes a man special, without which he is similar to an animal.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Why are you looking down O woman? What of yours has fallen on the ground? Oh! Oh! Fool! don’t you know, lost is my youth’s jewel!”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “Life is misery without music.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “Our dwelling place is a place of prayer.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “There is nothing that educates a man better than his experience.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “Do not be stubborn, give up your sins, repent.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “The ears enjoys hearing words.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “Hold fast to firm faith.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “Find your way in the world.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “Keep calm in crisis.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “Stand firm in the storm.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “Pray always pray.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “Always, remember that you are a mortal being.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “A man's only aim is to live in fulfilment of his mission.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “This is how far the Lord has helped us. Still firm faith in the LORD God, we lead us forward.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “I pledge allegiance to the Lord Jesus Christ, my Saviour.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “Without a peace of mind, how could the people have a healthy body?”

Author: RUMI
Quotes: “The very centre of your heart is where life begins - the most beautiful place on earth.”

Author: Shunya
Quotes: “Big elephants get stuck in small pits. Don’t lose your self-confidence when petty problems of life overwhelm you. You’re the big elephant.”

Author: Tom B. Night,
Quotes: “But the surest way to live a worthwhile, meaningful life was to have already done so, those moments etched forever into the fabric of spacetime.”

Author: Lyssa-ann Clarke
Quotes: “There is no ONE reason why people fail as People fail when they are not empowered to win.

Author: James Thomas Kesterson Jr
Quotes: “Fixing problems is like breaking a pencil. It's very hard to break many pencils at one time; however, if you try breaking one at a time it's very easy to do.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “This crisis calls for a change.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “The promises of God shall be fulfilled in the perfect time.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “With prayerful faith in the spirit of persistence, we shall behold the promises of God.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “My heart trust in God, thereof, I am helped.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “Do not resent the righteous God, when He rebukes you.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “There is no place like a place of payer.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “There is no place like a place of prayer.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “God with me, He is mighty to save.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “When you fall, do not stay down, look for the strength within to rise.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “Faith in the LORD God is the only certainty of life.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Oil on water, a secret shared with an evil person, a donation given to a worthy recipient, and scriptures in the possession of an aware person; these on their own gain expansion, due to their inherent strengths.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Although far, yet not far is the one who in the mind resides; but one who is not in the heart, although near, yet is far”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “From whom something dear is desired, to that person always speak dearly; the hunter kills the deer by songs sung melodiously.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “He lives, who has merits; who has righteousness, he lives; devoid of merits or righteousness, living is useless.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “According to the occasion witnessed, should be the speech; according to the glory seen, should be the dearness; according to one’s strength, should be the anger; one who knows this is a knowledgeable man.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Righteousness, wealth, grains, words of a Guru, and medicines, should be well-preserved, otherwise you cannot survive.”

Author: Rajen Jani
Quotes: “Discard evil company, cultivate good people’s association; undertake virtue day and night, remember the certainty of uncertainity.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “One who gives the knowledge of even a single letter, is a Guru; the student is one who fully understands it; in this world there is no substance that the student can give to repay his debt to his Guru.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Wicked people and thorns, in two ways can be counteracted; either with the shoe smash their faces, or from afar discard them.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “One who wears dirty clothes, one who has dirty teeth, one who eats too much, one who speaks cruelly, one who sleeps after sunrise or before sunset, is discarded by Shree, the goddess of wealth, although he may be the discus-bearer, the god Vishnu himself.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “When one’s wealth is lost, his friends, his wife, his servants, and his relations, all forsake him; and when wealth is regained, then all those who had forsaken him, come back; therefore, in this world, wealth is the only true friend and relative.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Sinfully acquired money stays for ten years; in the eleventh year, it is completely destroyed along with the principal amount.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “An unsuitable object in the hands of a capable person becomes suitable, while a suitable object in the hands of an incapable person becomes unsuitable.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “A jewel rolls on the feet, a glass on the head is kept, but at buying-selling time, a glass is a glass, and a jewel is a jewel.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Endless are the scriptures, too vast is knowledge, limited is time, and many are the obstacles; thus the essence should be taken, like a swan takes out the milk from water.”

Author: Shunya
Quotes: “Whatever happened in the past brought you to this point in life. If you are sad at this point, you will say, “It happened for bad.” If you are happy at this point, you will say, “It happened for good.”

Author: Shunya
Quotes: “For a migratory bird, there is one supreme truth, “Sky is the freedom.” If it enters into a room by accident, it tries to get out by flying upward. It keeps banging its head against the ceiling. It fails to find the door or windows because it firmly believes that freedom is upward, not sideways.

Author: Shunya
Quotes: “You lock your house and go out for a week. When you return, everything seems strange inside the house. The house grows in your absence! Everything in the universe is sitting on Time and continuously growing, with or without you.

Author: Shunya
Quotes: “Success is like a high profile person and “Struggle” is her grumpy secretary who doesn’t let you meet her easily. When you befriend “Success”, when you become worthy of her friendship, you can meet her directly.”

Author: Shunya
Quotes: “A cloth seller is wandering from street to street. It’s evening, still no sales. It feels like he is walking through a desert, dying to get a drop of water, dying to make a sale. He is frustrated now. He gets angry at a customer who actually wanted to buy a lot of clothes from him.

Author: Vanna Nguyen,
Quotes: “I never forgot who Queena was before the attack, but she was so different now that it almost felt like I had a third child.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “If the king is righteous then the subjects are also righteous, if the king is wicked then the subjects are also wicked, if the king is equally righteous and wicked, then the subjects are also equally righteous and wicked, the subjects behave according to the behaviour of the king, as the king is, likewise are the subjects.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Although apparently alive but devoid of righteousness, to me that person is dead; and although dead but was filled with righteousness, that person lives long, without doubt.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “The hearts of low men burn with jealous fire upon seeing the fame of others; unable to reach the famed status of others, they start to slander the famous others.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Bondage is a mind that is attached to objects, and freedom is a mind that is unattached to objects; the mind is the cause for human bondage or freedom.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Who obtains all happiness as desired by the heart? In God’s control is everything; therefore, contentment is the refuge.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “As in a thousand cows, a calf goes towards its mother; likewise, a performed act goes towards its doer.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “One who has no stability in his work, is not happy either in society or in a forest; the society burns him with social gatherings, and the forest burns him with the lack of society.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “According to the work the result is obtained, and intelligence also follows work; therefore, discerning persons undertake only such work, which is well-thought out in details.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “In this world there are only three jewels: water, food, and sweet speech; fools consider pieces of rocks as jewels.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “From the tree of crimes committed by oneself, comes forth fruits in the body as poverty, sorrow, disease, bondage, and affliction.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Again wealth, again a friend, again a wife, again a kingdom; these all can be gained again, but a human body cannot be gained again and again.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Large numbers can unitedly overcome an enemy; the rainfall holding cloud by a large number of grass-blades is overcome.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “Faith is a fierce fire.”

Author: Brajesh Kumar Singh
Quotes: “Let's ride hard towards your goal.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “Children are full of courage.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “Our existence on earth is for our enjoyment.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “Do not be stubborn, repent of your sins.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “Without peace, there is no progress.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “Why should you be stubborn? Stop living sinful lives.”

Author: Chaker Khazaal,
Quotes: “Hard storms make great sailors”

Author: Ms. Frizzle
Quotes: “Take chances, make mistakes and, get messy!”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “Praying leads to then practice of piety.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “Praying leads to the practice of piety.”

Author: Tom B. Night,
Quotes: “...life is a war we all lose in the end, but every day is a battle, and you can sure as hell win some of those.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “From grains ten times better is flour, from flour ten times better is milk, from milk eight times better is meat, from meat ten times better is ghee.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Sorrow increases disease, rice in sweetened milk increases body, ghee increases sperm, meat piling upon meat increases.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Generosity, sweet speech, patience, and knowledge of what is appropriate, cannot be gained by practice; these four are inborn qualities.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “One who forsakes his own people and joins another group of people, himself causes his own destruction; like a king who destroys himself by forsaking his kingly duty to follow another duty.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “A goad controls an elephant’s vast body, is the goad as vast as the elephant? A lamp when lighted banishes darkness, is the lamp as vast as the darkness? Struck by a thunderbolt a mountain is split apart, is the thunderbolt as vast as the mountain? No, in brilliance is might seated, what is there in mere vastness?”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “One engrossed in affairs of the home cannot gain knowledge, a meat-eater shows no mercy, a greedy materialist has no truth, a deceiving woman has no purity.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “An evil person will not become a saint, even if he is taught in several different ways; a Neem tree will not become sweet, even if it is watered by milk and ghee from its very top to its very roots.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “The inner filthiness of an evil person cannot be washed away, even by hundred baths at a pilgrimage; just like an earthen pot of wine cannot be made clean, even if in fire it is truly heated.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Until the qualities of another person are known, one always devalues that another person; just like the wife of a hunter, not knowing the quality of a pearl obtained from the head of an elephant, throws it away in favour of a Gunja seed.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “One who always consumes silently his meals for a whole year, resides in the heavenly world for one thousand crore years.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Lust, anger, greed, delicacies, ornamentations, nosiness, excessive sleep, and excessive service; for a student, these eight are forbidden.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “One who lives by eating roots from unploughed fields, and fruits that have fallen on the ground, who always resides in forests, who daily performs the worship of the departed ancestors, such a Brahmin is known as a Rishi.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Whatever accumulated wealth is in surplus of their needs, good people donate it for good causes; Karna, Bali, Vikramaditya, these kings are even remembered today due to their charity; the honey-bees store up honey, and then some honey-collector takes all the accumulated honey away; neither did the honey-bees themselves enjoy their stored up honey, nor did they give it in charity; all they do now is rub both their legs in regret.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Competent among own people, kind with other people, wickedly-clever always towards evil people, loving towards good people, arrogant with base people, guileless with learned people, courageous against enemies, forgiving towards elders, and cunning with women; in these arts, that man who is skilful, in him the regard of the people is established.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “In the company of saints an evil person becomes a saint, but a saint in the company of evil persons does not become evil; the scent of a flower is absorbed by the earth, but the scent of the earth is not absorbed by the flower.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Truth is mother, knowledge is father, righteousness is brother, kindness is friend, peace is wife, forgiveness is son, these six are my relatives.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Non-everlasting is the body, wealth is also not permanent, always together stays death; therefore, righteous acts do accumulate.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “To see one’s own mother in another man’s wife, to see useless pebbles in another man’s wealth, to see oneself in all beings of the world; one who sees thus, truly sees.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Knowledge is a friend in a journey, a wife is a friend in home, medicine is a friend in disease, and righteousness is a friend in death.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Courtesy from the sons of a king, good speech from a learned man, unrighteous behaviour from gamblers, and deceits from women, should be learnt.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “One who spends recklessly, one who is an orphan, one who loves quarrels, and one who is eager for all kinds of women, such a man is swiftly destroyed.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Having no meal does not worry a learned person who has gained awareness, for righteousness alone is his worry; the food of every person is created at the time of the person’s birth.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “In matters regarding the utilization of wealth and grains, in the accumulation of knowledge, and in eating a meal, the person who discards shyness, becomes happy.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “A drop of water falling regularly fills up a pitcher; this is the objective of all knowledge, righteousness, and wealth.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Neither grieve for the past nor worry for the future; in the present time engage like a man of discernment.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Gods, good men, and one’s father, are satisfied by one’s nature; relatives are satisfied with hospitality of a bath, food, and drink; whereas, scholars are satisfied when asked to give discourse.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Life-span, work, wealth, knowledge, and death; these five are created when inside the womb resides the body.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Oh! Say how strange is the nature of great-souled people! They consider wealth as light as a straw; however, under its weight they humbly bend down in salutation!”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “This attachment only is fearful, this attachment only causes sorrow, attachment is the root of sorrow, one who discards attachment becomes happy.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Prior to the arrival of the expected problem, one who applies various solutions to solve it; and when an unexpected problem arrives, one who can apply its correct solution immediately; both of these persons progress happily; but the fatalist is destroyed, as he does nothing and simply leaves everything to fate.”

Author: Shunya
Quotes: “If the tree of life has given you the task of collecting leaves from the ground, do it blissfully. What you see as waste may be the compost that can help the fruits ripen early.”

Author: Sofus Fabritius Christensen
Quotes: “Fremskidt er den eneste vej frem”

Author: Sofus Fabritius Christensen
Quotes: “Forkast det individ der giver sig til at kaste æg efter et hønsehus”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “The sensitive secrets that are known only between themselves, if spoken out by any of them, then that vile man destroys himself like a serpent straying in an anthill.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Fragrance in gold, fruit in sugarcane, flowers in sandalwood, a scholar with wealth, and a king with long life; these the Creator did not create; it seems like there were no advisors.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Among all medicines, nectar is foremost; among all material happiness, a hearty meal is foremost; among all sense organs, the eyes are foremost; and among all parts, the head is foremost.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “A student, a servant, a traveller, a hungry person, a frightened person, a treasury guard, and a doorkeeper; these seven, if asleep, should be awakened.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “A snake, a king, a wild beast, a stinging wasp, a child, someone else’s dog, and a fool; these seven, if asleep, should not be awakened.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Having half and incomplete study of the Veda, and having meals fit for a Shudra; that Brahmin what can he do? Without poison a mere snake.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Whose anger does not produce fear, whose satisfaction does not gift wealth, who cannot punish or help, if he is enraged, what can he do?”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “A poisonless snake should also greatly extend his hood; poison or no poison, the display of the enlarged hood itself is fearsome.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “In poverty is patience seated, in a bad garment is appearing good seated, in bad food is heating seated, in ugliness is good manners seated.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “One without wealth is not poor, wealthy he is decidedly; but one who is without the jewel of knowledge, is poor in all respects.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “If pleasure is desired then study has to be discarded, if study is desired then pleasure has to be discarded; how can the one enjoying pleasures undertake study? Where is the enjoyment of pleasures for the one who studies?”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “Fact is never faith.”

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita
Quotes: “A man decides his course in the circumstance.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “What cannot be seen by poets? What cannot be accomplished by women? What does a drunkard not tell? What does a crow not eat?”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Fate makes a beggar a king, and a king a beggar; it makes a rich man into a poor man, and a poor man into a rich man.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “The miser’s enemy is a beggar, the fool’s enemy is an intelligent man, the adulterous wife’s enemy is her husband, a thief’s enemy is the moon.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Those who have no learning, no penance, no charity, no knowledge, no good conduct, no virtue, and no righteousness; they are from the world of the dead and on the earth are simply a burden; in the form of humans, they roam around like deers.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “At the end, without a summarized essence an instruction cannot be given; being in the company of the Malaya Mountain does not make a bamboo tree a sandalwood tree.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “One who does not possess his own awareness, what can scriptures do for him? One who is blind, what can a mirror do for him?”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “To make a bad person into a good person, no solution exists on this earth; even if the anus is washed a hundred times, yet it does not become a superior organ.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Hating one’s own self results in death, hating others results in one’s loss of wealth, hating the king results in one’s annihilation, and hating a Brahmin results in the ruin of one’s family.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Better to live under a tree in a forest full of tigers and elephants, eat fruits and drink spring water, lie on the grass and wear torn barks of trees, than to stay in the midst of relatives, living a life without wealth.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “A Brahmin is like a tree, whose roots are the evening prayers, whose branches are the Vedas, and whose righteous acts are the leaves; hence, the root should be carefully protected, for if the root is torn, then there will be no branches and no leaves.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “In a single tree reside various coloured birds, who at dawn fly off in ten different directions; in this what is there to grieve?”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “The intelligent is strong, how can the unintelligent be strong? In the jungle, the lion in his arrogant madness was killed by the jackal.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “What worry have I for my maintenance, if Hari Vishvambhara is the supporter of all? If this were not so, then for supporting the life of the baby, how would the mother’s breasts be filled with milk? Thinking this every moment, O lord of the Yadus, O husband of Lakshmi, only your lotus feet I serve always and spend my time as prearranged by fate.”

Author: Rajen Jani,
Quotes: “Although Sanskrit language has a special intelligence of its own, yet I also yearn for other languages; like although nectar is the intoxication in heaven, yet gods desire the intoxicated lips of the heavenly ladies.”
